epyr.fair.conversion

Main conversion functions and workflows for Bruker EPR to FAIR format conversion.

This module provides the high-level interface for converting Bruker EPR data to FAIR-compliant formats using the EPyR Tools package.

Functions

batch_convert_directory(input_directory[, ...])

Convert all Bruker EPR files in a directory to FAIR formats.

convert_bruker_to_fair([input_file_or_dir, ...])

Load Bruker EPR data using eprload and convert to FAIR formats.

save_fair(output_basename, x, y, params, ...)

Save already-loaded EPR data to one or more FAIR formats.

validate_conversion(fair_json_file[, ...])

Validate a FAIR conversion by checking the JSON metadata file.
epyr.fair.conversion.convert_bruker_to_fair(input_file_or_dir: str | Path | None = None, output_dir: str | Path | None = None, scaling: str = '', output_formats: List[str] = ['csv_json', 'hdf5']) → None[source]

Load Bruker EPR data using eprload and convert to FAIR formats.

This is the main conversion function that handles the complete workflow from loading Bruker data to saving in FAIR-compliant formats with structured metadata.

Parameters:

  • input_file_or_dir – Path to Bruker data file (.dta, .dsc, .spc, .par) or directory. If None or directory, opens file dialog.

  • output_dir – Directory to save converted files. If None, saves in same directory as input file.

  • scaling – Scaling options passed to eprload (e.g., ‘nPGT’).

  • output_formats – List of formats to generate. Options: ‘csv_json’, ‘hdf5’.

Returns:

None. Prints status messages and warnings.

epyr.fair.conversion.save_fair(output_basename: str | Path, x: ndarray | List[ndarray] | None, y: ndarray, params: Dict[str, Any], original_file_path: str, output_formats: List[str] = ['csv_json', 'hdf5']) → None[source]

Save already-loaded EPR data to one or more FAIR formats.

This function is useful when you have already loaded EPR data and want to save it in FAIR formats without going through the loading process again.

Parameters:

  • output_basename – Base path for output files (without extension).

  • x – Abscissa data array(s) or None.

  • y – Ordinate data array.

  • params – Dictionary of parameters from the original file.

  • original_file_path – Full path of the original loaded file.

  • output_formats – List of formats to save. Options: ‘csv_json’, ‘hdf5’.

Returns:

None. Files are saved to disk.

epyr.fair.conversion.batch_convert_directory(input_directory: str | Path, output_directory: str | Path | None = None, file_extensions: List[str] = ['.dsc', '.spc', '.par'], scaling: str = '', output_formats: List[str] = ['csv_json', 'hdf5'], recursive: bool = False) → None[source]

Convert all Bruker EPR files in a directory to FAIR formats.

Parameters:

  • input_directory – Directory containing Bruker EPR files.

  • output_directory – Directory to save converted files. If None, saves alongside original files.

  • file_extensions – List of file extensions to process.

  • scaling – Scaling options passed to eprload.

  • output_formats – List of formats to generate.

  • recursive – If True, search subdirectories recursively.

Returns:

None. Prints progress and summary.

epyr.fair.conversion.validate_conversion(fair_json_file: str | Path, original_data_file: str | Path | None = None) → Dict[str, Any][source]

Validate a FAIR conversion by checking the JSON metadata file.

Parameters:

  • fair_json_file – Path to the JSON metadata file from FAIR conversion.

  • original_data_file – Path to original data file for comparison (optional).

Returns:

Dictionary with validation results including warnings and statistics.
